page.title: 15HILLSIDE
page.content: Hillside is east of Odiham and south of the A287 Farnham road. The primary land cover is pasture land, with areas of rough grazing land. At Bullock's Farm, maize and hay are used as fodder The farm-labourers cottages built in 1896,around Hillside, have been converted into large country houses. Bullock's Farm and Hillside Farm were built in 1981. Hillside is the larger farm. Hillside Farm has a number of small lakes, some natural and others man-made. The disused chalk pits belong to both Bullock's Farm and Hillside Farm. They have existed since 1830. One chalk pit is completely over grown with vegetation. The other pit is used for dumping the wheat-chaff. Local people use the slopes in winter for sledging. The gas station is used as a storage base by maintenance men.
